result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Berequias Silvestre Marcelo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Berequias Silvestre Marcelo appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Reyes appeared by video for Berequias Silvestre Marcelo.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Sworn as interpreter: Judy Veramendi.
Defense counsel recently appointed and has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture.
Case adjourned to Branch 15. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 095817,
Payable Number: 1037505,
Receipt Number: 22RP040427,
Amount: $20.00
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Berequias Silvestre Marcelo in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/21/22 @ 1:30p
